content:
Re: More versioning thoughts.

David J. Fiander (davidf@worf.mks.com)
Fri, 07 Jun 1996 08:33:11 -0400

  • Messages sorted by: [ date ][ thread ][ subject ][ author ]
  • Next message: David J. Fiander: "Re: Versioning Thoughts (in HTML)"
  • Previous message: David J. Fiander: "Re: High-level capabilities"
  • Maybe in reply to: Andre van der Hoek: "More versioning thoughts."
  • Next in thread: Larry Masinter: "Re: More versioning thoughts." 
> Sometimes you can get people to agree on the answer even when they
> can't agree on the question. So I'm not so worried about divergent
> goals. On the other hand, a Functional Requirements document would be
> the right way to deal with the issue of common goals. Does someone
> (not me) want to draft a Functional Requirements document and submit
> it by next Thursday as an Internet Draft? (Mainly just to raise
> awareness of the issue.)

Larry, this sounds like a good idea.  My only question is, under
who's aegis will the ID be posted?  Is it an "individual
submission", or will it be posted as an HTTP WG ID?

- David
